verse.roman:
tat kāliyaḥ paraṁ veda
nānyaḥ kaścana lelihaḥ
avātsīd garuḍād bhītaḥ
kṛṣṇena ca vivāsitaḥ

synonyms: tam—that; kāliyaḥ—Kāliya; param—only; veda—knew; na—not; anyaḥ—other; kaścana—any; lelihaḥ—serpent; avātsīt—he dwelt; garuḍāt—of Garuḍa; bhītaḥ—afraid; kṛṣṇena—by Kṛṣṇa; ca—and; vivāsitaḥ—expelled.
translation: Of all the serpents, only Kāliya came to know of this affair, and in fear of Garuḍa he took up residence in that Yamunā lake. Later Lord Kṛṣṇa drove him out.
